Long term HIV survivors find familial support in unique S.F. group home

Antiretroviral drugs that turned HIV from a death sentence to a manageable condition gave thousands of people a new lease on life — and left many ill-prepared to deal with aging. A San Francisco communal home called Marty’s Place gives survivors an affordable and supportive place to live.
